page.title: 02Dowland & Iddesleigh (cont)
page.content: Farms vary from 20 acres to approximately 400 acres, mainly small mixed with some larger farms with grain, beef and sheep; some dairy with crops of kale, corn, hay and silage. Two areas of felled deciduous woods are replanted with conifers, to be used for timber. Small private deciduous woodland near Iddesleigh is owned by Westpark Farm, Iddesleigh. A small sub Post Office is situated in Iddesleigh village, opening for 4 half days per week. A public telephone kiosk is near the post office on the village green. There is one inn in the area called 'The Duke of York'. It is in the centre of Iddesleigh village and provides a bar for local residents and accommodation and meals for visitors.
